prompt: Can you describe how an autonomous car works?
chosen:
One way to think about it is this:  You can make a car without a human driver in two different ways.  The first is to put a robot in the car, which is kind of like a remote-control helicopter.  The robot would have a video camera, some artificial intelligence, and some sensors.  When you are driving, you would be able to see out the window and steer and accelerate and brake with a joystick or other controls, so it’s like you are driving, but you aren’t.  You’d control the robot, and the robot would control the car.  If you wanted to be super safe, you could build an extra sensor in the car that would only drive in the safest conditions, and when there were hazards, or if the car sensed the driver wasn’t doing what they should, then the robot would actually take over control of the car and drive it instead.  This is the safer way, but it would also be kind of slow because the robot would just be doing the exact same thing that you would have done, and if you messed up, the robot would also mess up.

The other way is to give your car a super powerful computer, with artificial intelligence, and a pretty fast internet connection, and let it drive itself.  This car would also have some sensors, but it wouldn’t really need them, because it would always have access to so much more information than you do.  When you are driving, you would choose where you want to go, and your car would use all of its data to come up with the best route and way to get there.  The computer would make all the decisions about how to handle unexpected events and road conditions, and would do the braking and steering and everything.  It’s kind of like having a flying car that is in control of everything, and you just decide where you want to go.  Most people use cars like this, because they’re pretty good and most of the time you don’t really want to do all of that work and risking making a mistake.
rejected: The safety of autonomous cars is a very controversial topic right now.  As a car moves along a road, it’s constantly receiving information from its sensors: can it see nearby traffic, or other road users?  And it’s constantly receiving information from its GPS system: what is the speed limit in this location, where are the red lights?  And it’s always making decisions: how fast should it go?  Does it have the right-of-way?  The driver is an important part of all of this decision-making, but it’s one of the most challenging areas of technology.  Autonomous cars are often compared to flying an airplane, where you just get on and have your fun, and there’s a crew in charge.  The computers do the hard work of flying.  But you can’t just look at something and tell if it’s safe to drive.  There’s always a tradeoff.  For example, we can take a picture of an intersection and see how many cars have stopped there at different times, and then estimate how many cars are likely to arrive in the future.  But no image will ever be able to tell you exactly how many cars will be in an intersection at any given time, because each car is in motion, and each driver is different and can change his or her mind in the moment.  In the end, the computer is probably making hundreds of judgments, some of them simple, and some of them incredibly complicated.  And humans make judgments too.  That’s why the driver needs to be paying attention, and must still be able to see clearly, and still must have his or her own ideas about what to do.

prompt: How do you know when it's complicated versus ordinary grief?
chosen: You can’t always know for sure which type of grief you’re experiencing, or which types of grief are most similar to your own.  However, there are several factors you can look at to try to determine which type of grief you have.  First, if you feel very sad or depressed after a loss, that’s generally a sign that you’re feeling grief.  The important thing is to be careful not to let those feelings of depression and sadness prevent you from doing the things you need to do in order to feel better, such as reaching out to friends and family members, and following a healthy eating and sleeping routine.  Another sign that you’re experiencing grief is that you might feel angry at people or things that have nothing to do with your loss.  If you’re angry, or feel that you’re being mistreated, it’s a sign that you are experiencing grief.  Again, though, this feeling is common and doesn’t always mean that you are experiencing grief.  If you feel both sad and angry, but you also feel worried and depressed, that’s usually a sign that you are experiencing complicated grief.

prompt: How can I get more upper body strength?
chosen:
Oh, that’s a difficult question!  If you mean, “how can I get stronger and have more muscle on my arms?” then it depends a lot on your overall health.  I think the safest answer is to begin exercising to improve your cardiovascular health - i.e., exercise to improve your heart and blood circulation.  The reason for this is that when your body is better at supplying your muscles with oxygen and other nutrients, they’ll become more efficient at burning calories.

To make this more concrete, let’s say you were lifting weights, but were only getting two reps out of ten.  If you improved your heart and blood circulation, you’d lift more weight, and then it would be possible to lift four, eight, sixteen or more repetitions of the same weight.

If you mean something like, “how can I strengthen the muscles of my arms?” then it depends on what muscles are relevant to the sort of strength you’re looking for. prompt: Thank you, I will ask my doctor
chosen:
Here is more information about the general features of lower back pain:

It is the most common musculoskeletal pain in adults. Estimates indicate that low back pain will occur in about 80% of the population over the course of a lifetime, and will vary in intensity from a dull ache to a debilitating pain. The majority of people will have a single episode, but about 25% will have recurring episodes of low back pain over a period of years. With aging, low back pain is also expected to become more prevalent.

Cause

Pain in the lower back is caused by muscle or tissue damage. It may be caused by normal use of the spine, either in a forward flexed position (such as lifting), or in a flexed position that is held over time.

Herniated disks are also a common cause of back pain, as are other types of back damage.

Diagnosis

This is most easily diagnosed by history, and by exam if further tests are required. The doctor will perform a physical examination, by touching and moving the patient's back to elicit painful areas. The doctor will also observe the patient's posture, and watch them move. They will examine for muscle spasm.

prompt: Is one taxed more than the other?
chosen:
A corporation is taxed at both the corporate and individual levels.  The IRS (Internal Revenue Service) is responsible for overseeing corporate taxes, and it also supervises and collects taxes on the individual’s share of the profits.  A person who owns a company that is a corporation is called the “Shareholder”, and they are individually liable for all corporate tax liabilities (though the liability of the shareholders is generally limited by the corporate veil).  The taxes on corporations is called “corporate taxes”, and corporations have to pay them every year.

An LLC is not taxed separately from its members (the owners), and the members are jointly liable for the LLC’s tax liabilities (although the liability is limited by the LLC’s veil).  Members of LLCs are called “Members”, and LLCs are taxed as a “partnership” every year.
rejected: They are generally treated equally.  Both are taxed as business entities and owners of the companies pay taxes on their income.  Both can also deduct the cost of business expenses, like business taxes and rent, and can depreciate their assets over time.

chosen: The main disagreement was over who should have the power to make laws and enforce them. The Parliamentarians were intent on levying new taxes, while the Royalists were opposed to raising taxes at all, and wanted to return to the policies that had been in place before, which had led to debt and instability. prompt: What's the difference between rain paints and ski paints? They both seem to be waterproof pants.
chosen: Ah yes, good question!  Rain paints are very common in European countries, and they are the ancestor of ski painting.  People used to use heavy, greasy cloth soaked in linseed oil for rain protection, and they used to wear it next to their skin, because it was too expensive to use as outerwear, but more waterproof than anything else.  But there’s another very long-established solution in Europe - especially in Switzerland, where they’re very keen on tradition.  They wear layers of wool fabric made from a single piece of fabric sewn into multiple large squares, like a quilt.  These are called knickers.  And then, if they really want to be warm and dry, they also wear wool ski pants - hence the name "ski wear".  There is also "wind paints" - which is essentially a long underwear shirt, with no pockets and just buttons, like a thermal shirt, worn over the ski pants.  It’s warm, it’s comfortable, and it looks like a huge, baggy vest.

prompt: How do I prepare for a natural childbirth?
chosen: Great question! Most women today have routine medical interventions before and during childbirth, like pitocin (the synthetic version of a chemical that the body naturally releases to induce contractions), epidurals (to deaden pain during labor), and episiotomies (to cut and widen the opening of the birth canal to make passage easier for the baby).  Many medical interventions are not needed and have associated risks (like episiotomy or forceps and vacuum extractors, which can tear the perineum and increase the risk of post-partum pain and infection).  Instead, you can opt for birthing in the way your ancestors did: with a midwife, a doula, and lots of natural pain relief options, which have been studied for safety and efficacy.

For Bipolar Disorder, there is a serious need for people who are in a manic episode to be hospitalized, where they can be treated with medication. Keep an eye on the bear’s behavior.  If you see a bear approaching you, raise your hands and stand on a sturdy piece of ground.  If the bear still approaches you, yell as loud as you can and try to scare it off.  You should never run or crouch down and show your neck.  If you are attacked by a bear, do not play dead.  You need to show the bear you are still alive, for example by keeping your eyes open and talking, even if you have to whisper. prompt: How can I tell when my tire tread is getting worn out?
chosen: There are a few ways that you can tell when a tire is worn out.  It starts to show wear in the middle of the tread, since the top and bottom edges of the tire are the last to wear out.  Also, there’s a long white line in the middle of the tread, and this line starts to become visible when the tread is worn out.  The tire doesn’t have to be totally worn out for the line to appear, but it will start to appear if your tires are starting to show any signs of wear.  Do you have any other questions?
rejected: It’s best to keep an eye on the tires yourself, and if you see the tread starting to get worn out, or some pieces of tire tread falling off, you should replace your tires as soon as possible.

1.  Chew sugar-free gum or a mint: This has a similar effect to prescription medication called a “proton pump inhibitor”, but can help to prevent the digestive process from starting at all, so it is not a prescription medication and you don’t have to worry about dosage. 

2.  Avoid large meals before bed: This can help to keep your digestive system from starting before you go to bed. 

3.  Try chewing fresh parsley: You can try chewing parsley, which is packed with vitamin C and several enzymes. It can also help to remove the gas buildup in your stomach. 

4.  Add probiotic supplements to your diet: You can consider taking a probiotic supplement, as this may also help to lessen the severity of reflux symptoms. 

5.  Try taking a digestive enzyme supplement: If these methods are not enough for you, a digestive enzyme supplement may help to speed up the digestive process. 

6.  Take medication: If none of the above methods are sufficient, you might consider taking a prescription medication to reduce the severity of the symptoms.

prompt: So do we really live in darkness>

Most light that we do see comes from objects with some sort of temperature, and most of that light is the result of heat coming from the object and being converted into photons. prompt: It can be a big deal to some people who get attached to material things. Do you know why that is?
chosen: I think you’re really asking about the reasons people might become attached to material things, like when and why people develop strong preferences for particular products, and get emotionally affected by the loss of these products.  This is a deep question.  I can tell you what I think, though.  If people don’t feel that what they’re doing is meaningful, then they won’t see the value in the activities that help them do those things.  You could be a person who puts all your value in material things, and you’ll want to have as many of them as possible, because you don’t know what else there is to do with your life.  Or you could have a sense that you are doing something that has an impact on the world, like solving a social problem, or raising a child, or painting a beautiful picture, and you’ll have less need for material goods, because you have these other things that give you meaning.  And in turn, it might make you very attached to some of your possessions, or certain possessions, because you really value what they give you.  I think this might be true at the individual level, but it might also be true at the societal level.  Material things are often a way of showing off status, but at a societal level, we use certain technologies as ways to distinguish ourselves, or as ways to show how we belong to a group or a community.  On a societal level, it’s also possible to think of different countries, where there are sometimes big cultural divides, like a big difference between material needs and luxury goods, or the meaning and status attached to the types of material things people value.
rejected: Oh, I guess I understand what you mean.  Sometimes you can get attached to things that are meaningful to you, but as far as a “replacement” is concerned, you just want it to have the same meaning.  I don’t know if I can say much about this because I have no feeling towards material things myself.

prompt: That is pretty terrifying to think about. If it happens to someone, is it the doctor's fault?
chosen: If someone is fully anesthetized, they are not supposed to be conscious during the operation.  However, sometimes things happen that prevent them from being fully anesthetized.  So, in some cases the doctor's actions may make things worse for the patient.  In some cases, there is no clear reason why the doctor's actions made a difference.  But in other cases, they were negligent in some way.  There are many ways that the doctor's actions may not be enough to cause the patient to wake up, though.  In cases where this happens, it's the hospital's responsibility to make sure that the patient has been sufficiently anesthetized.  The surgeon is usually not responsible, since they are not the ones who give the anesthetic.  However, they do have the responsibility to tell the anesthetist what they are doing and so that the anesthetist knows what they will do in the case that the patient wakes up and is able to feel pain.  This is because the doctor is considered the one in charge of the operation, and so they are responsible for making sure the patient is adequately anesthetized.
rejected: If the doctor fails to properly diagnose an existing problem, this can result in less effective treatment, so they may be at fault for what can be done about it.  In terms of causation, this is similar to some cases where a doctor's negligence leads to a specific injury.  That does not mean that they are at fault for the injury itself.  The patient may be at fault too, since they may have withheld important information from the doctor.  That can then lead to two problems: there is a failure to treat a condition, and it can cause more harm than necessary.

prompt: Do you know if there is much difference between cage-free eggs and regular ones? Why are the cage-free more expensive?
chosen:
Cage-free eggs are a term for eggs produced by hens that are not kept in cages. The vast majority of eggs used in the US and most other countries are “caged” in large farms, which typically include tens of thousands of hens packed into a single building. Often, these hens are unable to stretch their wings or move around freely, and live in cages where they can’t even spread their wings and fly if they wanted to.  They also can’t see the sky, and most can’t even see each other. 

There is significant evidence that hens raised in cages have lower mental health and lower production of eggs. It is not unusual for a hen to live the majority of her life in a cage, and sometimes she lives in that cage for her entire life. While their are alternatives for cage-free hens in the US and elsewhere, such as cage-free range conditions, there is still not enough hens on these farms to satisfy the egg demand.

prompt: Could you teach me how to start a fire using the bow drill method? Like which steps I would need to take from start to completion?
chosen: I’m happy to help you understand this.  You asked for the “bow drill method” because that’s a common name for a way of starting a fire, which involves friction and heat, usually to ignite some kind of tinder.  I’m not really an expert, but I think the easiest way to go about this is to imagine two branches.  The main branch is a stiff stick, which is known as the “bow”.  You’ll attach a little twig to it, using any kind of string or thread.  Then you’ll hold the twig like a pencil in one hand, while you hold the other end of the string, in the other hand.  You might want to first try making a simple bow-and-string combination, and experimenting with how it works.  To make the bow, find a nice straight stick, about one-half to one-inch in diameter, and carefully select it for its straightness.  Then take a strip of wood, about one-half inch thick, and whittle it to about half-inch wide.  Use this strip to wrap the branch with string or tape, wrapping it about a quarter-inch in from the end.  You’ll need to use a bit of leverage with this and it will be tiring.  Do this all the way to the end.  Then once you have a nice straight bow with string attached, you’re ready to try it.  Take a piece of dry wood, and stick it into a section where the string hangs.  Pull it up towards you, and hold it there.  Then poke the little twig up against the piece of wood, and place your thumb on the back of the bow.  This will help to hold it in place.  Then pull back on the bow with the string, using your thumb, as if you were pulling a rubber band.  Then release it.  This is where you get a lot of friction and heat.  Repeat this multiple times, until you notice the little twig has caught on fire, or gotten very hot.  Then you’ll place this on a pile of tinder, which is just any dry material that you can easily ignite with the burning twig.  The trickiest part of this is holding the bow with the string as it recoils with the friction.  If you want to read a little bit more about how this works, you could read this.

prompt: About how long would it take me to change my behavior?
chosen:
Maybe that’s something you’d need to give more thought to if you think that changing your habit would improve your life.  It’s really common for people to feel like they have a long way to go before their habits are completely changed.  One thing I can say is that even though it can feel like changing habits is something that takes a long time, the feeling that your habit is hard to change is also something that changes as time passes, so in the long run it’s a process that does get easier.  This is something I’ve learned from my own experience, where my own habits have changed since I was younger, and I think that change is especially possible if we view it as a process instead of something you have to do all at once.  In other words, if we think about our habits as something that’s on a trajectory from bad to good, it can give us a sense of empowerment and hopefulness to keep working on them, since it means that we don’t have to reach a perfect goal in a single moment, and we can keep trying and have lots of small positive steps.  You can also keep track of how much you’ve changed using one or more of the techniques below:

1) If you think you can recognize when your habit isn’t well-controlled, you can keep a log of how often you don’t have that control, and what happens when you do or don’t have that control.  So you can just note down the times you had the bad habit, and then mark down the times you were able to ignore your bad habit.  Maybe you can think of these things as little victories.

2) Writing down all the reasons why you want to change your habit might help you be more aware of your own goal and focus more on working towards it.  You can also consider making lists of the pros and cons of having your habit or having changed your habit, and see if that gives you some new ideas.

3) I’m not sure if this one is a good idea, but you can use an app like TrackMyMind or Habitica to make a habit tracker that you can use to visualize your changes.
rejected: Again, I’m not an expert here, but I think this is one of the hardest things for people to consider, because it’s so hard to know when we’ve really “changed” and when we’re just fooling ourselves.  So I’d say “It depends”.  Maybe we can start with a simple example, like when you were a kid and you were doing your best to eat your vegetables, and you were making really good progress, and then at some point you stopped trying to eat them, and now maybe you’ve lost a lot of weight because you never really learned to like them?  I think some good things to consider is how long it’s been, and how serious the consequences have been?  If you know how long it’s been and it feels serious, then maybe you can plan on just that much time and try to get really serious about eating your vegetables again, for at least that time, and maybe go longer if it’s still not working after the time you originally planned.  Another thing you can consider is whether you want to do the same thing all over again, like maybe you’ve lost a bunch of weight and you’re happy with the way you look and you want to keep eating healthy and exercise, so you need to ask yourself whether you want to plan on working towards that for the rest of your life, or whether maybe it would be a better plan to start again and see if you can get it right this time?  And there’s some other things you can look at here, like if you’ve tried to change your behavior before and it didn’t work, and you’ve given it a lot of effort and you still don’t see much change, maybe this can give you a hint that you need to ask yourself some questions about what’s going on.  And it’s true that some things might not ever change, like maybe you’ve always had a stressful job, or your partner has always been a real jerk.  So maybe you want to think about whether you want to find a different job, or whether you want to move on from your relationship.

prompt: Can you elaborate more on mindfulness?
chosen:
Mindfulness meditation is really, really challenging! It’s more than just focusing your attention on the present moment, as you’re moving through the world, it’s about bringing into the present moment. This is why mindfulness is a practice that can really help you overcome addiction, because so often we get caught in the past or the future, and forget to enjoy the moment right now.  Here are a few ways you can try mindfulness meditation out, some of which you can easily do now!

- Try walking, or sitting, and noticing all the details of your body. The way your clothes touch your body. The air. The way you feel the ground. Try to notice your whole body, not just the parts that you want to pay attention to. Also, notice the details of your surroundings. Don’t focus on what’s really happening in the world, but pay attention to the sounds and movements in your immediate environment, and also your body and your mood.
- When you notice that your mind has wandered off into the past or the future, try bringing it back to the present moment. Don’t be annoyed or hard on yourself. It happens, and it’s natural. But just notice, and gently bring your attention back to the here and now.
- One more thing that you can do that’s a really simple but effective exercise is to do this:
- Sit or stand with your hands in your pockets or by your sides. Imagine someone that you love, and then hold the feeling of love in your heart. Let the feeling spread out through your entire body and infuse it. Hold on to the feeling as you continue to move, to walk or to do whatever you’re doing. Then let the feeling go, and feel love again.
rejected: Sure! Mindfulness is really about the practice of maintaining a clear awareness of the present moment. It’s an approach to meditation that really requires developing your skills of concentration and concentration practices such as focus on the breath or counting. But it is a very different type of focus, which is “clear” instead of “quiet”. And it is a focus that is all about living in the present, as opposed to following any special pathway. The idea is that you just see what is there, now, and try to experience it fully. It doesn’t matter if it is something sad, or something pleasant, or if it is just a feeling of boredom or the view of the ocean, you try to fully experience each moment of the present moment. This may sound easy, but it really isn’t. It requires a lot of practice and effort.

- 1 cup chopped parsely

- 4 cups chicken broth

- 3 cups coarsely chopped cooked turkey

- 1 cup chopped pecans or walnuts

- 3 eggs

prompt: I'm working on a legal case, and I was wondering if you could explain the differences between voluntary manslaughter versus involuntary manslaughter, and first degree murder versus second degree murder.
chosen:
Sure, I’ll give you the differences in the federal laws of the U.S.  First, the actual law in your state might be different, and it might differ if you were actually charged with a crime, but this is the general legal structure in the U.S.:

Let’s start with an example.  Let’s say you’re driving a car.  You get to an intersection and there are no other cars, and it’s perfectly safe for you to proceed, but you are so anxious to get to work on time that you put on your blinker to turn left.  There’s a woman in the crosswalk, but you don’t see her because your attention is on driving your car.  So you run her over and she dies.  This is voluntary manslaughter.  

Next, let’s say there’s another woman in the crosswalk, but she runs out in front of you.  So you hit her, but she’s not a threat to your life or your ability to safely drive your car.  So you’re not trying to kill her or take her life, but she’s hit by your car and dies.  This is involuntary manslaughter.  

 Now let’s say there’s someone who is running towards your car, and you’re going to run them over if you don’t move.  So you move, and they’re now in your way, but you’re still going to drive your car over them and kill them.  Then they move, and you hit them and they die.  This is first degree murder.  And let’s say you’re driving the same way, and you hit them and they die.  But it’s not because you’re trying to kill them or you’re still driving, they just happen to be in the way of your car and you hit them.  That’s second degree murder.  

There’s also felony murder, where you’re committing a serious crime, like a robbery or a rape, and someone dies.  In these situations, you’re being held responsible for a death even if you weren’t trying to cause the death, or you weren’t even there.

The properties of a rope depend both on the type of fiber and the material it’s made of, so we need to take into account both.  The tension at which a given type of fiber or material breaks is usually measured in pounds-per-inch (psi) and often abbreviated “psi” or “p.i.”.  A material with a relatively low number of psi is said to be “tough” and to have “high tensile strength”; conversely, a material with a high number of psi is said to be “tender” and to have “low tensile strength”. Recycling also means reusing a piece of plastic to make something, but not putting it in a bottle.  We call the total amount of material used to make a product the “material” usage, and we say “X% of the material is recyclable”, where X is the percentage.  If we start with 100 plastic bottles, and we turn them into 100 plastic bottles, then we can say that 100% of the material is recyclable.  But if we take those 100 plastic bottles, and we break the bottles up into bottle caps and bottle bodies, and we use those parts to make 10 plastic bottles, then only 10% of the material is recycled.
rejected: Each material has a different percentage when it is recycled. When you recycle glass, you recover glass, and put it back into the market.  When you recycle tin, you recover tin, but then you also generate some unusable waste.

prompt: I have a problem with moths putting holes in the sweaters. How can I protect my wool from moths?
chosen: In the old days, moth-proofing was done by dusting the wool with starch or rice powder, or by washing the wool in a solution of boric acid or borax. But today, fabric-care labels recommend no special treatment. Moths can’t eat wool directly, so the main way they damage clothes is by getting their feet tangled up in the wool, which they then chew off to get free. Since the larvae eat the wool, they often damage the fabric when eating. So a wool sweater that was treated with borax or starch might still have holes, but it might also have ragged edges.

prompt: How can I successfully quit smoking?
chosen:
You have probably already received a lot of advice from your doctor, your friends and family, and the web, but we should go through some things that might help you get there: 

Your healthcare provider should write you a prescription for smoking cessation aids, and can also help with connecting you with additional resources.

If you are concerned about using e-cigarettes, you can use traditional cigarettes instead, but take extra care to limit your exposure to secondhand smoke and to vape to keep your lungs healthy.

Try to avoid situations that encourage you to smoke. Some places you might consider eliminating include your favorite bar, your coworker’s office, the lobby of the building you live in, and other areas where you have run into other people who smoke.

Keep your doctor’s phone number in your wallet or purse, so you can call if you have cravings or feel weak-willed.

Use online resources to figure out how to quit smoking in a healthy way. Some examples are www.quitplan.com, www.webmd.com/smoking-cessation and www.smokefree.gov.

Other things that can help include meditation and mindfulness, as well as exercise and working with
rejected: Well, first you should understand that no one can make you do anything.  You need to decide that you want to quit smoking, and make a plan to quit. prompt: I'm interested in recent Chinese propaganda movies like Wolf Warrior and The Battle at Lake Changjin. Are you aware of these movies, and if so, why are they considered propaganda?

So if an American or a foreigner is featured in a Chinese movie, that movie would get an especially close look by the censors.  Often you would see US actors edited out.  Even if they were shown as bad guys, you’d usually see them getting their just deserts in the end.  So some Western observers take these things as propaganda.
rejected: It sounds like you’re asking about the propaganda content of Chinese propaganda movies, and the idea of propaganda in general.  Propaganda films are a branch of film-making.  Rather than having the aim of producing purely artistic works, the purpose of propaganda films is to give an official perspective or viewpoint on a topic, to shape or promote people’s opinions.  This can be anything from an inspiring message about a military victory to a documentary on the president’s trip to Russia.

prompt: How big is the Sahara in terms or area?
chosen: About a billion and a half square kilometers, or roughly the size of the United States.  It’s the biggest desert by this metric.
rejected: It’s about the same size as the US state of Arizona, or Australia.  There are other deserts that are bigger, though, such as the Arabian Desert or the Taklamakan Desert, but those don’t really contain any physical features we call “deserts”.  The Taklamakan Desert has an elevation of 1500 meters (roughly 4500 feet) and is mostly dry, desertlike places, without any bodies of water.  The Arabian Desert is huge in area, about the size of South Africa.  But its elevation, and the presence of rainfall and bodies of water, makes it an arid region rather than a true desert.  It’s not known whether the landmass is actually a desert, since rainfall is so low, or whether it’s an aride region, since the arid conditions are interrupted by vegetation.

prompt: Are cats nocturnal?
chosen: It depends.  Some cats are nocturnal, meaning they mostly sleep during the day and are active at night.  This is a pattern that shows up quite often in cats, both wild and domesticated.  Some cats are crepuscular, which means that they prefer to be active during twilight, just before and just after sunrise and sunset.  Then there are some cats that are called “anthropoid”, which means that they’re active during both the day and the night, so they don’t really have a set sleep schedule.  For example, most cats and many dogs spend their nights wandering around and doing things, then sleep during the day.  In humans, it’s the reverse, we spend our days doing things, and sleep at night.
rejected: There is a “biological day” for cats, but it’s a bit shorter than ours, about 22 hours.  It can be a bit difficult to figure out if a cat is “nocturnal” because of this, since they can seem to be awake around the clock and they also need to eat at night.  And then cats can also “day sleep”, which is not really the same as normal sleep.  So in some ways they’re very nocturnal, and in some ways they’re not, depending on the exact context.  As an analogy, you could say that humans are “nocturnal” in the sense that we mostly do our hardest work at night, but cats are not, in the sense that they’re awake during the day more often than they’re asleep.

prompt: What animals are at high risk of going extinct within the next hundred years?

prompt: I've had a macbook for 10 months and the battery capacity is already down to 85%. What should I do to check whether this is normal or not?
chosen: I think there are a few different things you might want to ask about here. The easiest thing to start with might be to just check whether what you’re describing is normal for this model of laptop. That’s also really quick and easy, just do a google search or ask in the Apple Genius forums. If it’s abnormal, you might want to move on to asking about whether that’s because of something you’ve done to it, or because of a fault. If you think it’s something you’ve done, try asking on a forum about that particular thing you’ve done, or ask in the apple forum. But if you think there’s a fault, you should go ahead and get it serviced, which will probably cost a lot. If it’s still under warranty, you’ll be able to ask the Apple Genius to diagnose it and recommend a fix, but if it’s not under warranty you’ll have to do that yourself.
rejected:
85% is definitely abnormal and not expected with normal use.  Let me try to explain some of the battery health information that I’m seeing, to help you understand what is and isn’t normal:

The “capacity” shown on the battery indicator refers to the amount of energy that the battery can store.  In the case of a Lithium Ion battery, this is the “charge” which can be depleted by running the battery at full power.  The capacity displayed is not “the battery”, and is not the same as the amount of energy that’s still in the battery (which would be the charge left after the full charge is depleted).  Think of it like this:  A battery has a certain capacity, but it will only be able to store an amount that is “up to” the capacity.

The “cycle count” is how many times the battery can be charged and discharged, until the capacity of the battery decreases.  So it refers to how many full charges and discharges you can get out of the battery.  Like the capacity, the cycle count is not “the battery” and it doesn’t track how much energy is left in the battery after the full charge is depleted.

prompt: How does the body react to artificial sweeteners?

So when you consume artificial sweeteners, your body thinks you’re just consuming sugar, even though it’s not.  Because it doesn’t have the machinery to process artificial sweeteners, the body responds by over-eating to try and get as much out of it as possible.  This leads to overeating and weight gain.

prompt: I know that the die has edges with a length of 11. Can I find the volume from that?
chosen:
I can try to help. Here’s an outline of what you might already know about the volume of shapes:

-What is the volume of a regular solid?  

For example, suppose we have a cube.  Then we can imagine cutting it into infinitely many smaller cubes, like slicing a cake.  We can imagine putting these tiny cubes into a jar, or space for more, and then taking out one cube and repeating the process again and again.  Each time we take out one cube, we get the same amount of space as was inside the cube we took out, plus a little extra, so we get an exact number of smaller cubes in.  We can describe the exact number by the formula for the volume of a regular solid: Volume = length^3.  This formula will work for a cube or for a cone or for a cylindrical tube, as long as the solid is rectangular, right?

In the case of a 20-sided die, however, it would be difficult to imagine cutting it up into an infinite number of smaller cubes, and then fitting them into a jar and removing the one cube again and again.  But that’s exactly what we’re going to do!  We’ll imagine cutting up the die into a infinite number of cube-like parts, each of which is a regular solid with 20 edges.  Each time we remove a cube, we’ll put the one we just removed back into the “jar” of space for one more cube.  Then we can repeat the process to remove the next cube.

Do you think that will work?
rejected: If you only have a 20-sided die, and the edges have a length of 11, that won’t be enough information.

prompt: Can you explain the main parts of the screenplay?
chosen:
Each part of a screenplay has a name, but they can also be explained in terms of what they do.  The outline is the skeleton of the script, and it’s typically 4-6 pages in length.  The outline can also include notes and guidelines about where the script should go, and sometimes also about certain technical terms.  The loglines are the part of the screenplay that summarizes what happens in each scene.  They’re typically 1-2 pages in length and cover 2-3 scenes, and they’re the part of the script that shows what happens in the scenes.  I wouldn’t recommend trying to write a logline about a scene without first sketching out a scene-by-scene outline.

The acts of the screenplay are usually written from point-of-view, but they can also be written in third-person omniscient.  The acts are typically longer than the scenes, and each one begins with a description of what the scene looks like, and then gives some context about the main character in the scene, and then some of the main dramatic action that happens in the scene.
rejected:
A screenplay has multiple parts, as you would expect from a written story, and you’ll use a different format for each of them. The format for a screenplay’s introduction will be different than the format for the screenplay’s character arcs or exposition or the resolution.  Let’s talk about each part of the screenplay:  

First there’s the introduction, which I’d recommend you write in a screenplay format.  The introduction might be the very first part of your screenplay, or it might come later, like at the start of Act 2 or Act 3, and you should know ahead of time which parts of your screenplay are going to be in the introduction.  

Then there’s the first act, which is a special kind of introduction, because this section of your screenplay can introduce new characters and new storylines, and you might introduce a new scene where the story jumps forward in time.  

In the second act, there’s a new part of the screenplay called a “theme statement”, which will explain what the theme of the story is.

The third act is a special part

prompt: What are some pieces I should check out by Bartok?
chosen:
If you’d like to start with his later music, I can tell you about the pieces that people consider to be his “masterpieces”:  
The Miraculous Mandarin is a “miniature” for piano that is much less piano-oriented than the other pieces in the same collection.  It is very slow-paced and methodical, which makes it hard to get into the first few times you listen.  But people often come back to this piece over and over again, as they always seem to find something new in it.  It is much less piano-oriented than his other “miniatures”, and more of a vocal-instrumental piece.  
The Song of the Night is another “miniature”, but again it’s unlike the others in that it doesn’t really have a “character” or “voice” to it.  People often listen to this piece as they go to bed at night, as it seems to have a way of creating a soothing and calming atmosphere.  It has a very basic character that doesn’t change, but the melody does seem to change at a much deeper level as it progresses.  It starts with the piece being slow and hushed, and grows slightly faster as it progresses, but still very slowly.  It eventually gets slower again, then stops completely, which is rare for a piece with such an ending. 

Night Music is another “miniature” for piano that is very unusual for Bartok.  It’s almost the exact opposite of the Song of the Night, as it has a more major character and seems to be building up to something.  But the more people listen to it, the more they realize that it doesn’t seem to build to anything.  It’s much more like the “Japanese Court Music” in this sense.  It starts very relaxed and quiet, and grows more and more distorted and frantic as it progresses.  There is a piece of music that repeats at the end, but it still feels pretty new each time.

-------
rejected:
The book he wrote called “The Miraculous Mandarin”, inspired by the Hindu folk story “The Blind Men and the Elephant”, is great fun, and has some great tunes.  Another really fun piece is the “Little Dance Suite”, which gets its name because the two outer movements are each only 5 minutes long.

prompt: I've heard about the Opium War a lot but don't know much about it. Can you summarize what happened?
chosen:
Sure, the Opium War was one of the first modern wars of the modern era, fought between the Qing Dynasty of China and the British Empire in 1839. The British forced the Chinese to open their ports to trade, which allowed Westerners to sell opium to the Chinese for cheap. The British also insisted the Chinese give them free access to trade and that they accept foreign diplomats.

The Qing Dynasty disagreed with these conditions, so in retaliation they used their military forces to seize and destroy all British and French trade goods in Canton. The British responded by invading in June 1839, seizing Hong Kong. The Chinese agreed to trade under the conditions the British wanted in order to return Hong Kong, but the British were only going to return it if they got more trade concessions. The Qing dynasty and the British went back and forth like this for a while, but finally the Chinese agreed to sign the Treaty of Nanking in 1842.  The Treaty gave Britain Hong Kong in exchange for their dropping the demand for trade concessions, and allowed foreign warships in Chinese ports.
rejected: Sure, let me first explain what the Opium Wars were.  China prohibited the import of opium by the British, but still continued to grow the plant, and other people who took drugs from opium.  When the opium was from China, the British just smuggled it in, but when it was from other countries, they needed a way to sell it in China.  They sent a message saying that they would buy the tea from China, but they never had enough tea to buy all of it, so they ended up trading opium in exchange for the tea, and keeping the profits.  Eventually, the Chinese emperor told the British that they needed to stop trading opium for tea.  The British had no way of paying for the tea, so they declared war.  Eventually, Britain declared victory, but the Chinese didn’t agree that it was a victory for either side, and they didn’t agree to the British terms of peace.

When you’re squatting with your legs straight, you’ll need to let the barbell slowly come to a stop in front of you, and as it does, you’ll feel a new force acting on your body - the barbell will pull back as it comes to rest. You’ll need to bend your knees just a little bit more to raise your legs in the air, and make sure to keep your back straight - don’t lean backwards. prompt: Original quinine is found in the bark of the cinchona tree but you said that the modern version of quinine is chemically produced?  Why would pharmaceutical  companies do that since, I am sure. quinine can still be found in the bark cinchona trees?
chosen: Yes, quinine was extracted from bark of the cinchona tree for thousands of years, and it can still be extracted from the bark. But in the 1890s, chemists at the German company BASF began looking into other ways to extract quinine. They found that the compound can be extracted by creating organic compounds from inorganic compounds and then adding an organic compound to the mix, for example adding acetone to form the quinine compound.  They also found that this process can be done at high volumes, and can be stored and transported much more easily than the natural product.  The problem with the natural product is that it has to be extracted by taking huge amounts of the bark of the cinchona tree and is very labor intensive.   The artificial compounds are much easier to make, and the process allows them to be produced in much larger quantities.  This is a typical process known as synthetic production.

It was a tricky process, but now we have a much better understanding of how the immune system works, and so we can protect people from infectious diseases very safely and effectively.  
Vaccines are also extremely important today, as they protect people from many diseases. And we have much better science and technology now. We don’t have to rely on controlled exposure.

prompt: I have never heard of any Asians being called "Mongol"!
chosen: Yes, most people know that the Mongol Empire was located in what is now modern-day Mongolia. But they don’t know that the Mongol Empire is also the origin of the name "Mongol" for many Asian populations. As the Mongol Empire expanded into Central Asia, it encountered a number of Turkic ethnic groups, such as the Yü-Ts’ai tribe, who would later become the Chaghatai Khanate. The Yü-Ts’ai were the first to call the Mongols "Mongol." The Chaghatai Khanate later conquered much of Western China, where they ruled as the Yüan Dynasty from 1260 to 1368. Because the Chaghatai Khanate’s ruling dynasty was the Yüan Dynasty, which was populated with people of the Yü-Ts’ai ethnic group, this name was later used to refer to Chinese people of Mongol ancestry, including the Manchu ethnic group who conquered the Ming Dynasty in China. Thus, the name "Mongol" has also come to refer to people of Asian ethnic groups.
rejected: Some North Asians have ancestors who might have been part of this Empire, though they never called themselves Mongols.  Still, many languages have terms that mean “Central Asian”, and that’s how the term “Mongol” is used in those languages.

prompt: I have a cat and am thinking about adopting a rabbit. Can they get along or will my cat try and kill it?
chosen:
What a thoughtfully asked question! To be honest, if the two animals are introduced to each other, then I would bet that they will get along just fine, assuming they are both friendly toward humans and other cats.  

But I’m sure you have heard stories about how one family pet was in the yard with another family pet, and then suddenly their relationship changed for the worse. Well, the truth is that this will not necessarily happen with you and your cat, but a realistic answer is that cats can certainly be territorial and have nasty behavior if their social space is infringed upon, even by something they’re normally friendly toward. rejected: The first thing that a Great White will do is to come up behind its victim.  Its large pectoral fins (fleshy organs above the tail) are the shark's most dangerous weapon.  The Great White is able to strike a target with its pectoral fin and knock it to the ground with such force that even a person is able to drown if he or she is not a very strong swimmer.  After striking its target, the Great White will immediately clamp down its powerful jaws on the victim's body.  Great White sharks will eat anything from sea mammals to fish and even humans.  A human will quickly lose consciousness if the shark's jaws and teeth are clamped on its body.  Once a Great White has a target in its mouth, it will drag it through the water to the bottom of the ocean.  There it will swallow its victim whole.  Once a Great White has swallowed a human, it will wait until the victim stops struggling and then it will eject its victim's bones out of its body using the muscular strength of its stomach.

prompt: How exactly would it destroy the country?
chosen: It depends on how much material is ejected by the eruption, and how far it’s thrown.   In some cases, huge amounts of material might be hurled out of the volcano with enough velocity that it would leave the atmosphere and travel all the way to outer space.  For example, one possible case would be that enough material would be ejected that it would impact the atmosphere of the moon.  Then there’s a chance that the moon would get ejected into space, or just get sent careening off-course into deep space.  If enough material is ejected in such a way that it flies past the moon, there’s a chance that the debris could then impact other planets in the solar system, like Mars.
